jsx.ui.vect
Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.vect.Canvas

public class Canvas
extends Widget

Defines a canvas widget.

A Canvas is a Widget that wraps a Component that wraps an HTML <canvas> element.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

arc

public static final void arc(Canvas c,
                             java.lang.Number x,
                             java.lang.Number y,
                             java.lang.Number r,
                             java.lang.Number a1,
                             java.lang.Number a2,
                             java.lang.Boolean ccw)

Adds an arc to the current sub-path of a canvas, using a center point and radius.

The first five arguments to this method specify a start point and an end point on the circumference of a circle. Invoking this method adds a straight line between the current point and the start point to the current sub-path. Next it adds the arc along the circumference of the circle between the start and end points to the sub-path. The final argument specifies the direction in which the circle should be traversed to connect the start and end points. This method leaves the current point set to the end point of the arc.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the center of the circle describing the arc.
y - The Y coordinate of the center of the circle describing the arc.
r - The radius of the circle that defines the arc.
a1 - Specifies the start point of the arc along the circle. The angles is measured in radians. The three o'clock position along the positive X axis is an angle of 0, and angles increase in the clockwise direction.
a2 - Specifies the end point of the arc along the circle. The angle is measured in radians. The three o'clock position along the positive X axis is an angle of 0, and angles increase in the clockwise direction.
ccw - Whether the arc is traversed counterclockwise (true) or clockwise (false) along the circle's circumference.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
arcTo(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number), beginPath(Canvas), closePath(Canvas)

arcTo

public static final void arcTo(Canvas c,
                               java.lang.Number x1,
                               java.lang.Number y1,
                               java.lang.Number x2,
                               java.lang.Number y2,
                               java.lang.Number r)

Adds an arc to the current sub-path, using tangent points and a radius.

This method adds an arc to the current sub-path but describes that arc much differently than the arc(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Boolean) method does. The arc that is added to the path by this method is a portion of a circle with the specified radius. The arc has one point tangent to the line from the current position to the point (x1, y1) and one point that is tangent to the line from the point (x1, y1) to the point (x2, y2). The arc begins and ends at these two tangent points and is drawn in the direction that connects those two points with the shortest arc.

In many common uses, the arc begins at the current position and ends at the point (x2, y2), but this is not always the case. If the current position is not the same as the starting point of the arc, this method adds a straight line from the current position to the start position of the arc. This method always leaves the current position set to the end point of the arc.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x1 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's start point.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's start point.
x2 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the arc's end point.
r - The radius of the circle that defines the arc.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
arc(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Boolean)

beginPath

public static final void beginPath(Canvas c)

Starts a new path (or a collection of sub-paths) in a canvas.

This method discards any currently defined path and begins a new one. It sets the current point to (0,0).

When the context for a canvas is first created, this method is implicitly called.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
closePath(Canvas), fill(Canvas), stroke(Canvas)

bezierCurveTo

public static final void bezierCurveTo(Canvas c,
                                       java.lang.Number x1,
                                       java.lang.Number y1,
                                       java.lang.Number x2,
                                       java.lang.Number y2,
                                       java.lang.Number x,
                                       java.lang.Number y)

Adds a cubic Bézier curve to the current sub-path.

The start point of the curve is the current point of the canvas, and the end point is (x,y). The two Bezier control points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) define the shape of the curve. When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x1 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's start point (the current position).
y1 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's start point (the current position).
x2 - The X coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the control point associated with the curve's end point.
x - The X coordinate of the curve's end point.
y - The Y coordinate of the curve's end point.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
quadraticCurveTo(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

clearRect

public static final void clearRect(Canvas c,
                                   java.lang.Number x,
                                   java.lang.Number y,
                                   java.lang.Number w,
                                   java.lang.Number h)

Erases the pixels in a rectangular area of a canvas.

This method erases the specified rectangle, filling it with a transparent color.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0

clip

public static final void clip(Canvas c)

Uses the current path as the clipping region for subsequent drawing operations.

This method clips the current path using the current clipping path and then uses the clipped path as the new clipping path. Note that there is no way to enlarge the clipping path. If you want a temporary clipping path, you should first call save(Canvas) in order to use restore(Canvas) to restore the original clipping path. The default clipping path for a canvas is the canvas rectangle itself.

This method resets the current path so that it is empty.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0

closePath

public static final void closePath(Canvas c)

Closes the current sub-path if it's open.

If the current sub-path of the canvas is open, this method closes it by adding a line connecting the current point to the sub-path's starting point. If the sub-path is already closed, this method does nothing. Once a sub-path is closed, no more lines or curves can be added to it. To continue adding to the path, you must begin a new sub-path by calling moveTo(Canvas, Number, Number).

You do not need to call closePath(Canvas) before stroking or filling a path. Paths are implicitly closed when filled (and also when you call clip(Canvas)).

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
beginPath(Canvas), moveTo(Canvas, Number, Number), stroke(Canvas), fill(Canvas)

createLinearGradient

public static final JsCanvasGradient createLinearGradient(Canvas c,
                                                          java.lang.Number x1,
                                                          java.lang.Number y1,
                                                          java.lang.Number x2,
                                                          java.lang.Number y2)

Returns a JsCanvasGradient object that represents a linear color gradient.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasGradient object that linearly interpolates colors between the specified start point and end point. Note that this method does not specify any colors for the gradient. Use the JsCanvasGradient.addColorStop(Number, String) method of the returned object to do that. To stroke lines or fill areas using a gradient, assign a JsCanvasGradient object to the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle or JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x1 - The X coordinate of the gradient's start point.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the gradient's start point.
x2 - The X coordinate of the gradient's end point.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the gradient's end point.
Returns:
A JsCanvasGradient object representing the linear color gradient.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createRadialGradient(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

createPattern

public static final JsCanvasPattern createPattern(Canvas c,
                                                  JsHTMLImageElement image,
                                                  java.lang.String repeat)

Returns a JsCanvasPattern object that represents a tiled image.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasPattern object that represents the pattern defined by a tiled image. To use a pattern for stroking lines or filling areas, use a JsCanvasPattern object as the value of the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle or JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be tiled. This argument is typically JsHTMLImageElement object, but you may also use a JsHTMLCanvasElement element (see createPattern(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)).
repeat - Specifies how the image is tiled. The possible values are the following:
  • "repeat": Tile the image in both directions. This is the default.
  • "repeat-x": Tile the image in the X dimension only.
  • "repeat-y": Tile the image in the Y dimension only.
  • "no-repeat": Do not tile the image; use it a single time only.
Returns:
A JsCanvasPattern object representing the pattern.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createPattern(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)

createPattern

public static final JsCanvasPattern createPattern(Canvas c,
                                                  JsHTMLCanvasElement image,
                                                  java.lang.String repeat)

Returns a JsCanvasPattern object that represents a tiled image.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasPattern object that represents the pattern defined by a tiled image. To use a pattern for stroking lines or filling areas, use a JsCanvasPattern object as the value of the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle or JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be tiled. This argument is typically JsHTMLImageElement object, but you may also use a JsHTMLCanvasElement element (see createPattern(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)).
repeat - Specifies how the image is tiled. The possible values are the following:
  • "repeat": Tile the image in both directions. This is the default.
  • "repeat-x": Tile the image in the X dimension only.
  • "repeat-y": Tile the image in the Y dimension only.
  • "no-repeat": Do not tile the image; use it a single time only.
Returns:
A JsCanvasPattern object representing the pattern.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createPattern(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, String)

createRadialGradient

public static final JsCanvasGradient createRadialGradient(Canvas c,
                                                          java.lang.Number x1,
                                                          java.lang.Number y1,
                                                          java.lang.Number r1,
                                                          java.lang.Number x2,
                                                          java.lang.Number y2,
                                                          java.lang.Number r2)

Returns a JsCanvasGradient object that represents a radial color gradient.

This method creates and returns a new JsCanvasGradient object that radially interpolates colors between the circumferences of the two specified circles. Note that this method does not specify any colors for the gradient. Use the JsCanvasGradient.addColorStop(Number, String) method of the returned object to do that. To stroke lines or fill areas using a gradient, assign a JsCanvasGradient object to the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle or JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle properties.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x1 - The X coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
y1 - The Y coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
r1 - The radius of the starting circle.
x2 - The X coordinate of the center of the ending circle.
y2 - The Y coordinate of the center of the starting circle.
r2 - The radius of the ending circle.
Returns:
A JsCanvasGradient object representing the radial color gradient.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
createLinearGradient(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public static final void drawImage(Canvas c,
                                   JsHTMLImageElement image,
                                   java.lang.Number x,
                                   java.lang.Number y)

Draws an image.

This method copies the entire image to the canvas, placing its upper-left corner at the specified point and mapping each image pixel to one unit in the canvas coordinate system.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be a JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x - The X coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
y - The Y coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public static final void drawImage(Canvas c,
                                   JsHTMLCanvasElement image,
                                   java.lang.Number x,
                                   java.lang.Number y)

Draws an image.

This method copies the entire image to the canvas, placing its upper-left corner at the specified point and mapping each image pixel to one unit in the canvas coordinate system.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be an JsHTMLImageElement object representing an <img> tag, or an offscreen image.
x - The X coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
y - The Y coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public static final void drawImage(Canvas c,
                                   JsHTMLImageElement image,
                                   java.lang.Number x,
                                   java.lang.Number y,
                                   java.lang.Number w,
                                   java.lang.Number h)

Draws an image.

This method copies the entire image to the canvas and allows you to specify the desired width and height of the image in canvas units.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be an JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x - The X coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
y - The Y coordinate of the point at which the upper-left corner of the image is drawn.
w - The width at which the image should be drawn. Specifying this argument causes the image to be scaled.
h - The height at which the image should be drawn. Specifying this argument causes the image to be scaled.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

drawImage

public static final void drawImage(Canvas c,
                                   JsHTMLImageElement image,
                                   java.lang.Number x1,
                                   java.lang.Number y1,
                                   java.lang.Number w1,
                                   java.lang.Number h1,
                                   java.lang.Number x2,
                                   java.lang.Number y2,
                                   java.lang.Number w2,
                                   java.lang.Number h2)

Draws an image.

This method allows you to specify any rectangular region of the image and copy it, with arbitrary scaling to any position within the canvas.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
image - The image to be drawn. This argument may also be an JsHTMLCanvasElement object.
x1 - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region of the image that is to be drawn. This argument must be an integer measured in image pixels.
y1 - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region of the image that is to be drawn. This argument must be an integer measured in image pixels.
w1 - The X dimension, in image pixels, of the region of the image that is to be drawn.
h1 - The Y dimension, in image pixels, of the region of the image that is to be drawn.
x2 - The canvas X coordinate at which the upper-left corner of the image region is to be drawn.
y2 - The canvas Y coordinate at which the upper-left corner of the image region is to be drawn.
w2 - The canvas X dimension at which the image region should be drawn.
h2 - The canvas Y dimension at which the image region should be drawn.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLCanvasElement, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number), drawImage(Canvas, JsHTMLImageElement, Number, Number, Number, Number)

fill

public static final void fill(Canvas c)

Fills the interior of the current path with the color, gradient, or pattern specified by the fillStyle(jsx.ui.vect.Canvas) property.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fillRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

fillRect

public static final void fillRect(Canvas c,
                                  java.lang.Number x,
                                  java.lang.Number y,
                                  java.lang.Number w,
                                  java.lang.Number h)

Paints or fills a rectangle.

This method fills the specified rectangle with the color, gradient, or pattern specified by the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.fillStyle property.

Current implementations of this method also clear the path as if beginPath(Canvas) had been called. This surprising behavior may not be standardized and should not be relied on.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fill(Canvas), rect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number), strokeRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

lineTo

public static final void lineTo(Canvas c,
                                java.lang.Number x,
                                java.lang.Number y)

Adds a straight line segment to the current sub-path.

This method adds a straight line to the current sub-path. The line begins at the current point and ends at (x,y).

When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the end point of the line.
y - The Y coordinate of the end point of the line.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
beginPath(Canvas), moveTo(Canvas, Number, Number)

moveTo

public static final void moveTo(Canvas c,
                                java.lang.Number x,
                                java.lang.Number y)

Sets the current position and begins a new sub-path.

This method sets the current position to (x,y) and creates a new sub-path with this as its first point. If there was a previous sub-path and it consisted of just one point, that sub-path is removed from the path.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the new current point.
y - The Y coordinate of the new current point.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
beginPath(Canvas)

quadraticCurveTo

public static final void quadraticCurveTo(Canvas c,
                                          java.lang.Number cx,
                                          java.lang.Number cy,
                                          java.lang.Number x,
                                          java.lang.Number y)

Adds a quadratic Bézier curve to the current sub-path.

This method adds a quadratic Bézier curve segment to the current sub-path. The curve starts at the current point and ends at (x,y). The control point (cx, cy) specifies the shape of the curve between these two points.

When this method returns, the current position is (x,y).

Parameters:
cx - The X coordinate of the control point.
cy - The Y coordinate of the control point.
x - The X coordinate of the end point.
y - The Y coordinate of the end point.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
bezierCurveTo(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number, Number)

rect

public static final void rect(Canvas c,
                              java.lang.Number x,
                              java.lang.Number y,
                              java.lang.Number w,
                              java.lang.Number h)

Adds a rectangle sub-path to the current path.

This method adds a rectangle to the path. This rectangle is in a sub-path of its own and is not connected to any other sub-paths in the path.

When this method returns, the current position is (0,0).

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fillRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number), strokeRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

restore

public static final void restore(Canvas c)

Resets the canvas to the graphics state most recently saved.

This method pops the stack of saved graphics states and restores the values of the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D properties, the clipping path, and the transformation matrix.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
save(Canvas)

rotate

public static final void rotate(Canvas c,
                                java.lang.Number a)

Rotates the canvas.

This method alters the mapping between canvas coordinates and the pixels of the <canvas> element in the web browser so that any subsequent drawing appears rotated within the canvas by the specified angle. It does not rotate the <canvas> element itself.

Note that the angle is specified in radians. To convert degrees to radians, multiply by MathLike.PI and divide by 180.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
a - The amount of rotation, in radians. Positive values result in clockwise rotation, and negative values result in counterclockwise rotation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Canvas, NumberLike), scale(Canvas, Number, Number), translate(Canvas, Number, Number)

rotate

public static final void rotate(Canvas c,
                                NumberLike<?> a)

Rotates the canvas.

This method alters the mapping between canvas coordinates and the pixels of the <canvas> element in the web browser so that any subsequent drawing appears rotated within the canvas by the specified angle. It does not rotate the <canvas> element itself.

Note that the angle is specified in radians. To convert degrees to radians, multiply by MathLike.PI and divide by 180.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
a - The amount of rotation, in radians. Positive values result in clockwise rotation, and negative values result in counterclockwise rotation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Canvas, Number), scale(Canvas, Number, Number), translate(Canvas, Number, Number)

save

public static final void save(Canvas c)

Saves the properties, clipping region, and transformation matrix of the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D object.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
restore(Canvas)

scale

public static final void scale(Canvas c,
                               java.lang.Number sx,
                               java.lang.Number sy)

Scales the user coordinate system of the canvas.

This method adds a scale transformation to the current transformation matrix of the canvas. Scaling is done with independent horizontal and vertical scaling factors.

Specifying a negative value for sx causes X coordinates to be flipped across the Y axis, and a negative value of sy causes Y coordinates to be flipped across the X axis.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
sx - The horizontal scaling factor.
sy - The vertical scaling factor.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Canvas, Number), rotate(Canvas, NumberLike), translate(Canvas, Number, Number)

stroke

public static final void stroke(Canvas c)

Draws, or strokes, a line following the current path.

The line is drawn according to the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth, JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin, JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineCap, and JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle properties, among others.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fill(Canvas), strokeRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number)

strokeRect

public static final void strokeRect(Canvas c,
                                    java.lang.Number x,
                                    java.lang.Number y,
                                    java.lang.Number w,
                                    java.lang.Number h)

Draws a rectangle without filling it.

This method draws the outline, but does not fill the interior, of a rectangle with the specified position and size. Line color and line width are specified by the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.strokeStyle and JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth properties. The appearance of the rectangle corners are specified by the JsCanvasRenderingContext2D.lineJoin property.

Current implementations of this method clear the path as if beginPath(Canvas) had been called. This surprising behavior may not be standardized and should not be relied on.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
x - The X coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
y - The Y coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
w - The X dimension of the rectangle.
h - The Y dimension of the rectangle.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
fillRect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number), rect(Canvas, Number, Number, Number, Number), stroke(Canvas)

translate

public static final void translate(Canvas c,
                                   java.lang.Number dx,
                                   java.lang.Number dy)

Translates the user coordinate system of the canvas.

This method adds horizontal and vertical offsets to the transformation matrix of the canvas. The arguments dx and dy are added to all points in any subsequently defined paths.

Parameters:
c - The current canvas widget.
dx - The amount to translate in the X dimension.
dy - The amount to translate in the Y dimension.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
rotate(Canvas, Number), rotate(Canvas, NumberLike), scale(Canvas, Number, Number)
